headline: India’s battery storage boom: Getting the execution right
summary_80w: India's ambitious drive for renewable energy has accelerated the need for energy storage, but there are many factors to success, writes Charith Konda of the Institute for Energy Economics and Financial Analysis (IEEFA).

headline: Acen Australia seeks federal green tick for 1,760MWh BESS in Queensland
summary_80w: Acen Australia has submitted plans for a 440MW/1,760MWh BESS in Queensland to the Australian government's EPBC Act.

headline: Elawan Energy inks PPA for 150MW Spain solar portfolio
summary_80w: Madrid-headquartered renewables developer Elawan has signed a 10-year power purchase agreement (PPA) to support a 150MW solar PV portfolio in northern Spain.

headline: IPP Juniper Green Energy secures debt financing for renewables build-out
summary_80w: Juniper Green Energy has secured INR17.39 billion (US$197 million) in debt financing from government-backed Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA).

headline: Study reveals broad origins of key cost-cutting PV innovations
summary_80w: A new MIT study has shown how many of the dramatic reductions in PV costs in the past 50 years were the result of innovations originating outside the solar industry.

headline: Report: Gaps in PV industry’s ‘fragmented’ approach to sustainability
summary_80w: The PV industry’s progress in meeting sustainability goals is patchy, with notable gaps in the end-of-life management of PV products, according to a review by IEA-PVPS.

headline: US solar could lose 60GW by 2030 due to executive order
summary_80w: CEA said the US could lose 60GW of planned solar capacity if strict "start of construction" rules come into force.

headline: Green Genius secures US$75 million for Lithuanian solar-plus-storage portfolio
summary_80w: Green Genius has secured €64 million (US$75 million) in finance to support the development of a solar-plus-storage portfolio in Lithuania.

headline: 141MWdc solar PV power plant in New South Wales submitted to Australia’s EPBC Act
summary_80w: ACE Power and Osaka Gas Energy Australia have joined forces to develop the 141MWdc Forbes Solar Farm in Australia.

headline: Polaris Renewable Energy submits plans for Puerto Rico BESS
summary_80w: Polaris Renewable Energy, on behalf of the Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority (PREPA), has submitted a battery energy storage system (BESS) standard offer (SO1) agreement to the Puerto Rico Energy Bureau (PREB).

headline: ‘We will be good for the distant future’: Enphase on domestic content and the value of residential storage
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium speaks with the Co-founder and Chief Products Officer of microinverter and home energy storage system supplier Enphase Energy, Raghu Belur, to discuss the domestic content of its systems and the company’s latest earnings report.

headline: Bangladesh seeks bidders for 160MW/640MWh renewables-shifting BESS projects
summary_80w: Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB), the main electricity company in Bangladesh, has issued an RFP for large-scale BESS.

headline: FlexGen wants to uphold Powin’s ‘important and significant’ legacy, CEO says
summary_80w: FlexGen “felt compelled to step up” and ensure the continuity of operation of the more than 11GWh of assets deployed by acquisition target Powin.

headline: Ingeteam to supply 70MWh of battery storage projects across Victoria, Australia
summary_80w: Ingeteam will deliver inverter solutions for seven battery energy storage system (BESS) projects in Victoria, Australia, totalling 70MWh.

headline: ‘West Africa’s first’ co-located BESS dedicated to frequency regulation commissioned in Senegal
summary_80w: Independent power producer (IPP) Africa REN has commissioned a solar and storage project in Senegal, which it claimed as the first of its kind in West Africa.

headline: Kentucky utilities shelve 1.6GWh BESS project, doubling down on fossil fuel expansion
summary_80w: Louisville Gas and Electric Company (LG&E) and Kentucky Utilities Company (KU) have withdrawn plans to deploy a new 400MW/1,600MWh BESS.

headline: Nextracker to supply 1.5GW Brazil hybrid solar portfolio with trackers
summary_80w: US solar tracker manufacturer Nextracker will supply 1.5GW of its products to a Brazilian solar PV hybrid project portfolio.

headline: Government of Brunei breaks ground on 30MW solar PV plant
summary_80w: The Government of Brunei Darussalam has broken ground on the 30MW solar PV power plant in Kampong Belimbing, the country’s largest solar facility to date.

headline: Highland Materials leases former nuclear site for Tennessee polysilicon plant
summary_80w: US polysilicon company Highland Materials has signed a long-term lease for the site of a planned “next-generation” polysilicon production facility in Tennessee.

headline: Fluence to hit lower end of 2025 guidance due to ‘typical’ ramping delays at US factories
summary_80w: Fluence expects to hit the lower end of its previously issued revenue guidance for the 2025 financial year due to delays in ramping up at US production sites.
